sen.j: 小出 吉英（こいで よしふさ、よしひで、天正15年（1587年）- 寛文6年3月9日 (旧暦)（1666年4月13日））は、江戸時代前期の大名。
sen.e: Yoshifusa KOIDE (or Yoshihide KOIDE, 1587-April 13, 1666) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo Period.
Yoshifusa KOIDE (also known as Yoshihide KOIDE, 1587 - April 13, 1666) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Yoshifusa KOIDE (also known as Yoshihide KOIDE, 1587 - April 13, 1666) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
He was the heir of Yoshimasa KOIDE.
He was the heir of Yoshimasa KOIDE.
He was the heir of Yoshimasa KOIDE.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、大和国守。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and Yamato no kuni no kami (governor of Yamato Province).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and Yamato no kuni no kami (Governor of Yamato Province).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), and Yamato no kuni no kami (Governor of Yamato Province).

sen.j: 正室は保科正直の娘、貞松院 (徳川家)。
sen.e: His lawful wife was Teishoin (the Tokugawa clan), the daughter of Masanao HOSHINA.
His lawful wife was Teishoin (the Tokugawa family), the daughter of Masanao HOSHINA.
His lawful wife was Teishoin (the Tokugawa family), the daughter of Masanao HOSHINA.

sen.j: 子に小出吉重、小出英信、娘（立花種長室）、娘（松平信之室）、娘（山内一唯室）。
sen.e: His children were: Yoshishige KOIDE, Fusanobu KOIDE, and three daughters (Tanenaga TACHIBANA's lawful wife, Nobuyuki MATSUDAIRA's lawful wife and Katsutada YAMAUCHI's lawful wife).
His children included Yoshishige KOIDE, Fusanobu KOIDE, and three daughters (Tanenaga TACHIBANA's wife, Nobuyuki MATSUDAIRA's wife and Katsutada YAMAUCHI's wife).
His children included Yoshishige KOIDE, Fusanobu KOIDE, and three daughters (Tanenaga TACHIBANA's wife, Nobuyuki MATSUDAIRA's wife and Katsutada YAMAUCHI's wife).

sen.j: 慶長9年（1604年）に父・吉政が和泉国岸和田藩に移った後、但馬国出石藩6万石を領した。
sen.e: After his father Yoshimasa moved to Kishiwada Domain in Izumi province in 1604, he governed the 60,000 koku in the domain of Izushi in the Province of Tajima.
After his father Yoshimasa transferred to Kishiwada Domain in Izumi Province in 1604, he governed the Izushi Domain in the Tajima Province, 60,000 koku.
After his father Yoshimasa transferred to Kishiwada Domain in Izumi Province in 1604, he governed the Izushi Domain in the Tajima Province, 60,000 koku.

sen.j: この際、叔父に当たる小出三尹に所領の一部を分知して和泉国陶器藩を立藩させている。
sen.e: At this time, he subdivided a part of his shoryo (territory), gave it to his uncle Mitsumasa KOIDE, who then founded the Toki Domain in Izumi Province.
On this occasion, he subdivided a part of his shoryo (territory), gave it to his uncle Mitsumasa KOIDE, who then founded the Toki Domain in Izumi Province.
On this occasion, he subdivided a part of his shoryo (territory), gave it to his uncle Mitsumasa KOIDE, who then founded the Toki Domain in Izumi Province.

sen.j: 慶長18年（1613年）、父が死去すると家督を継ぎ、岸和田に移ったため、出石は弟の小出吉親が継ぐこととなった。
sen.e: When his father died in 1613, he took over as the head of the family and moved to Kishiwada; therefore, his younger brother Yoshichika KOIDE succeeded the estate in Izushi.
When his father died in 1613, he took over as the head of the family and moved to Kishiwada; therefore, his younger brother Yoshichika KOIDE succeeded Izushi Domain.
When his father died in 1613, he took over as the head of the family and moved to Kishiwada; therefore, his younger brother Yoshichika KOIDE succeeded Izushi Domain.

sen.j: 後に岸和田から出石に移封となり、弟の吉親は丹波国園部に移封されて、園部藩を立藩する。
sen.e: Later, his domain was transferred from Kishiwada to Izushi, and his younger brother Yoshichika was moved to Sonobe in Tanba Province and founded the Sonobe Domain.
Later, his domain was transferred from Kishiwada to Izushi, and his younger brother Yoshichika was moved to Sonobe in Tanba Province and founded the Sonobe Domain.
Later, his domain was transferred from Kishiwada to Izushi, and his younger brother Yoshichika was moved to Sonobe in Tanba Province and founded the Sonobe Domain.

sen.j: 一方、吉英は新たに出石城を築城し、有子山城より居城を移転している。
sen.e: On the other hand, Yoshifusa newly built the Izushi-jo Castle and moved his castle to reside from Arikonoyama-jo Castle.
On the other hand, Yoshifusa newly built the Izushi-jo Castle where he moved to reside from Arikonoyama-jo Castle.
On the other hand, Yoshifusa newly built the Izushi-jo Castle where he moved to reside from Arikonoyama-jo Castle.

sen.j: 死後、家督は次男の小出吉重が継いだ。
sen.e: After his death, his second son Yoshishige KOIDE took over as the head of the family.
After his death, his second son Yoshishige KOIDE took over as the head of the family.
After his death, his second son Yoshishige KOIDE took over as the head of the family.
